question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024 (b) Pennsylvania does not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met: No referendum officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania by the specified date, no referendum with the primary focus on abortion rights protection occurs by the specified date, and no referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources by the specified date. If such a referendum meeting these criteria does occur by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

The overall question resolves as YES if at least one of (a) or (b) occurs by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Colorado enacts a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024, and (b) Indiana refrains from conducting a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as YES. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date qualifies for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Land O'Frost not issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
not_P.body:

1. No official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. No press release from Land O'Frost
3. No announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. No reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The absence of a recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the lack of product withdrawal. If such a recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

3. The new headquarters must not be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, this condition is not met.

question.title: Will Apple's Siri be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?

For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. question.title: Will Texas enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Texas enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). The referendum must be officially announced by the New York Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of climate change policies. This condition will resolve as NO if such a referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe. (2) By July 31, 2024, Alibaba officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. If an announcement is made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times) by the specified date, or if the announced measures specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, this condition resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if neither conditions (1) nor (2) are satisfied.

question.title: Will Google announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Google officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Google only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) A major South Korean battery company begins construction of a factory in Michigan, and (2) Google does not announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8%?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) Construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Michigan state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the condition is not met. (2) Google does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce. question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024 AND will Pennsylvania not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the FTC announces completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024, and (b) Georgia does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Georgia does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The referendum is officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum explicitly addresses the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

This combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024 and (b) the average rate on a 15-year mortgage not exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. (b) At no point during August 2024 does the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceed 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate exceeds 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the condition is not met. For clarity, the rate must not surpass 5.5%, it can be equal to or less than 5.5%. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

2. It must not be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If such a bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Apple finalizes a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024, and (b) the UK's House of Lords fails to pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Uber lays off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, and (b) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure never shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: 

(a) Uber confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

(b) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure does not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The absence of such an increase must be confirmed by the lack of official publications by the Reserve Bank of India or any relevant Indian government agency and not reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If any such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Mexican economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(b) The European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate. The presence of an announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reports by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is not made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

If at least one of (a) or (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as NO. Otherwise, it resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. (b) The International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If neither condition is met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

'Significant' in this context means less than 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must not be a result of government policy or directive, but rather due to voluntary closures or economic factors. (b) The International Monetary Fund does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and must not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Oregon conduct a referendum on abortion rights while California does not by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For this to occur:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) California does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For this to occur:
   1. No referendum meeting the specified criteria is officially announced and conducted by the state of California by the specified date.
   2. The primary focus of any conducted referendum is not on abortion rights protection.
   3. No referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources meeting the specified criteria.

The question will resolve as NO if either:
- Oregon does not conduct such a referendum by August 31, 2024, or
- California conducts such a referendum by August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel does not officially announce a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The absence of the announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The lack of an interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) large protests in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts, and (b) the Central Bank of Israel not announcing an interest rate cut?
question.body: This combined question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, this part will resolve as NO. (b) The Central Bank of Israel does not officially announce a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed by the lack of official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or the absence of reports by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) about an interest rate cut. The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as YES. If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the combined question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. question.title: Will a court rule on the liability of a major hotel chain operator by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. The ruling must be documented in official court records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). If no such ruling occurs by the resolution date, or if the case is settled out of court without a formal ruling, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the court to find the operator liable; it only requires a ruling to be made on the matter of liability.

not_P.title: Will a court not rule on the liability of a major hotel chain operator by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, no court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. The ruling must not be documented in official court records and not reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). If such a ruling occurs by the resolution date, or if the case is settled out of court with a formal ruling, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the court to find the operator not liable; it only requires that no ruling be made on the matter of liability.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024, and (b) No court rules on the liability of a major hotel chain operator by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame. 

(b) This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, no court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. This includes cases where the matter is settled out of court without a formal ruling. Note that this question does not require the court to find the operator liable; it only requires no ruling to be made on the matter of liability.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Tennessee hold a referendum on labor laws by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Tennessee officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on reforming labor laws in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Tennessee Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of labor laws. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

This will be based on the absence of official UFCW statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal) confirming an endorsement.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Huawei announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Huawei officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Huawei's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. The implementation must be confirmed through official state legislation or government announcements, and reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?

The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). (b) The French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. question.title: Will BNSF Railway reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both BNSF Railway and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the World Bank announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the World Bank officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points by August 2024, and (b) the World Bank does not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) At any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. The index level will be verified based on official reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the World Bank does not officially announce any new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. Verification will be based on announcements made through official World Bank channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs. If no such announcement is made, or if the total does not exceed $400 million, this condition is satisfied.

The question resolves as NO if either condition is not met.

question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will YouTube face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

The ethics code must not be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should not outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If such a code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) no enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This requires:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. This requires confirmation by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press) that no such code has been officially adopted. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement.

The question will resolve as NO if either:

1. No such referendum occurs in Michigan by August 31, 2024, or a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

2. An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established and officially adopted by July 31, 2024, meeting the specified criteria.

(a) By August 31, 2024, Michigan does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This requires:
   1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
   2. The referendum must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) By July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. This requires confirmation by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press) that such a code has been officially adopted. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement.

The question will resolve as NO if both:

1. Such a referendum occurs in Michigan by August 31, 2024, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

2. An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is not established and officially adopted by July 31, 2024, meeting the specified criteria.

not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs:

(a) By July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If such a code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, this part will resolve as YES. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a NO resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a negative resolution: 1. Such a referendum occurs by August 31, 2024. 2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date. 3. A referendum is held, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights. Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Canadian economy avoids a recession, and (b) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income does not increase by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. If the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must not be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Sony Corporation not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024 (b) Sony Corporation does not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery as of August 31, 2024. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

(b) Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no significant strike occurs at all. For the resolution to be considered valid: 
1. A strike involving a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants) does not end with an agreement by the specified date. 
2. The strike must last for at least one week if it occurs. 
3. The lack of resolution must be confirmed by the absence of official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union regarding an agreement. 
4. The lack of resolution or the absence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). 

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024 and (2) Andrew Bailey not remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. (2) Andrew Bailey is no longer serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on or before July 31, 2024, for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term). Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is still serving as Governor by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position. If both conditions are met by their respective resolution dates, this question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. The ban must remain in place without any changes that would effectively legalize the transactions. question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 31, 2024: (a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin, and (b) Nigeria lifts its ban on cryptocurrency transactions?

This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

(b) The government of Nigeria officially reverses its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions or makes changes that effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's reversal or weakening should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Cruise's robotaxis be available on Didi's ride-hailing service in China by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Cruise's autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) are confirmed to be operational and available for passenger rides through Didi's ride-hailing service in at least one Chinese city. Confirmation must come from official statements by either Cruise or Didi, or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch). (1) Cruise's robotaxis be available on Didi's ride-hailing service in China by August 31, 2024: This will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Cruise's autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) are not confirmed to be operational and available for passenger rides through Didi's ride-hailing service in at least one Chinese city. Confirmation must not come from official statements by either Cruise or Didi, or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch). The service must not be publicly accessible to regular Didi users, not just for testing or limited trials. If such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the partnership is not canceled or indefinitely delayed, the question will resolve as YES.

(2) Baidu announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 31, 2024: This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Baidu does not officially announce specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must not be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should not be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Baidu's AI systems. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current polio outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing polio outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Indonesian economy avoids a recession by July 2024 (b) The WHO does not declare the current polio outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing polio outbreak over by August 31, 2024. If the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, or if no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. The question resolves as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

question.title: Will the Bovespa index recover to its October 2023 level by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bovespa index closes at or above its closing level as of October 1, 2023. The closing level will be verified using data from reputable financial information providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Financial Times. If the Bovespa index does not reach or exceed its October 1, 2023 closing level by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. In case of any stock splits or reverse splits during this period, the index value will be adjusted accordingly for fair comparison.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Bank of Korea announces a reduction in its key interest rate and (b) The Bovespa index does not recover to its October 2023 level?
question.body:
(a) The Bank of Korea must publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.
(b) The Bovespa index must not close at or above its closing level as of October 1, 2023, by August 31, 2024. The closing level will be verified using data from reputable financial information providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Financial Times. If the Bovespa index reaches or exceeds its October 1, 2023 closing level by the specified date, this part resolves as NO. In case of any stock splits or reverse splits during this period, the index value will be adjusted accordingly for fair comparison.
The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur by the specified date.
